NVMeDrive Module¶

class havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.storage.nvme.nvme_drive.NVMeDrive(host, block_name, config)[source]¶

Bases: havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.storage.drive.Drive

__init__(host, block_name, config)[source]¶

Class for storing data and interacting with NVME drives

@param Host host: host object @param String block_name: drive name in /dev/ path @param String config: name of json file that control how drive data is

validated. NVMe configs are in directory NVME validate config are placed in two directories in

havoc/autotest_testfiles/validation_utils

  • cfg/nvme_smart

  • cfg/nvme_smart_fdi

_filter_vendor_config(config)[source]¶

Only get validate instructions for specific for this drive vendor

@param {} config: dictionary contains validate instructions

for a specified vendor

@return {}: filtered dictionary

_flatten_validate_config_dict(config)[source]¶
Reduce config with nested comparing instructions, like this
{

“smart-log”: {“item_1”: “==”, … }, “Samsung”: {

“vs-smart-add-log”: {“item_a”: “<”, … }

}

}

to

{ “item_1”: “==”, “item_a”: “<”, … }

_get_config_dir(ext_file)[source]¶
JSON files specific for Flash Data Integirty tests are placed in

nvme_smart_fdi. Other files go in nvme_smart.

@param string ext_file: NVME json file name @return string: directory with config file

_update_firmware(drive_name, file_name, fw_slots, action=1)[source]¶

@param String drive_name @param String file_name: firmware binary path @param int[] fw_slots: firmware slots to update @param int action: provide param for nvme fw-activate –action option

Collect drive data at this point in time. Should be overridden in sub-classes

get_drive_name()[source]¶
Get NVMe drive name without the namespace part

e.g. “nvme1n1” -> “nvme1”

@return string

get_nvme_ns_map(blockname, serial_number)[source]¶

To get the list of namespace associated with nvme drive. This is done by Mapping the NameSpace with the same Serial number. @return {‘nvme0’: [‘nvme0n1’, ‘nvme0n2’]}
